dt: {bc}one who advocates or practices {d_link|activism|activism} {bc}a person who uses or supports strong actions (such as public protests) in support of or opposition to one side of a controversial issue

dt.t: Antiwar {wi}activists{/wi} were protesting in the streets.

The conventional wisdom is that young people no longer care enough to stand up for what is important; that the days of activism and protest have faded into the past, the bailiwick of aging hippies and {wi}activists{/wi}.

utxt.t: What is news to me … is how much alike were the fears and concerns of both {wi}activistic{/wi} Democrats and skeptical Republicans …

shortdef: one who advocates or practices activism : a person who uses or supports strong actions (such as public protests) in support of or opposition to one side of a controversial issue

dt: {bc}advocating or practicing {d_link|activism|activism} {bc}using or supporting strong actions in support of or opposition to one side of a controversial issue

dt.t: For the {wi}activist{/wi} groups that will carry the nomination fight to the public, the name of the game is hit early and often.

Pressing demands that are both global and granular, the {wi}activist{/wi} investor has turned himself into one of the food sector's most influential players, affecting how millions of people eat each day.
They plan to become {wi}activist{/wi} shareholders who will protest global-warming resolutions and anything else that undermines corporate profitability.

shortdef: advocating or practicing activism : using or supporting strong actions in support of or opposition to one side of a controversial issue
